channel.title: [PI] Portforwarding with utorrent/bittorrent [PI]
channel.description:
[b][u]Oke for first i know there are so many tutorial about this, but i still keep seeing ppl having this problem in the help section so i make it again one more time realy fast and easy.[/u][/b]
1- Make an account on No-ip.com
2- Make and host (only make an IP the rest is bullshit) [img]http://i22.servimg.com/u/f22/16/52/06/54/no-ip10.png[/img]
3- Download No-ip Client (on the left of the site)
4- open No-ip Client Called "DUC" , and select the host u made on no-ip
5- Go into ur Client and open Client.java, and press CTRL+F
6- Searsh for "server" , and change all IP's u see to ur no-ip Host IP u just made, Compile it
7- open source
8- open Utorrent or Bittorrent, go to --> preferences --> Connection and typ port 43594
9- [b][u]Close source [/u] [/b]
10- Reopen Source
and ur done :D *NOTE if this works 1 time and after it it reject
then try port 5555, i always have some problems with port 43594 with my utorrent if u want to change it to port 5555 go in source file and pen server.java and searsh for 43594 and change all to 5555 after it open client.java on client side and searsh for 43594 and change it to 5555 then just change it into utorrent and ur done

item.title: [PI] Portforwarding with utorrent/bittorrent [PI]
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

Oke for first i know there are so many tutorial about this, but i still keep seeing ppl having
this problem in the help section so i make it again one more time realy fast and easy.

1- Make an account on No-ip.com

2- Make and host (only make an IP the rest is bullshit)

no-ip10.png734×317

3- Download No-ip Client (on the left of the site)

4- open No-ip Client Called “DUC” , and select the host u made on no-ip

5- Go into ur Client and open Client.java, and press CTRL+F

6- Searsh for “server” , and change all IP’s u see to ur no-ip Host IP u just made, Compile it

7- open source

8- open Utorrent or Bittorrent, go to --> preferences --> Connection and typ port 43594

9- Close source

10- Reopen Source

and ur done
*NOTE if this works 1 time and after it it reject

then try port 5555, i always have some problems with port 43594 with my utorrent
if u want to change it to port 5555
go in source file and pen server.java and searsh for 43594 and change all to 5555
after it open client.java on client side and searsh for 43594 and change it to 5555
then just change it into utorrent and ur done

Read full topic
